ygData.subject: Re: Attack through walls
ygData.msgSnippet: I understand that.  If the MOB is in ht pursuit of you, it  knows where you are and WILL and should be able to attack you, however if you are just
ygData.messageBody:
I understand that. If the MOB is in ht pursuit of you, it knows where you
are and WILL and should be able to attack you, however if you are just
resting....not attacking anything, in a house the MOBs should not be able to
see you to attack...like the griffons do all the time in west commonlands.



-----Original Message-----
From: rick.ulrich@... [mailto:rick.ulrich@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 1:25 PM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: [eq_wizards] Attack through walls


From: rick.ulrich@...

The reason an animal can attack through a wall is:

There would be safe spots..A bear could not fit through a door....If you
were losing a battle all you would have to do is run for shelter....Hey why
do that just stand in there an cast spells....Get it?



> _________________
>
> Message: 23
> Date: Tue, 27 Apr 1999 12:26:43 -0400
> From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>
> Subject: Re: BUG/FEEDBACK
>
> Err.... not to be a party pooper, but ever seen Jaws? They can explain
shark attacks any way they want. But probably the most glaring example of
this is the inn just off the road in Western Karanas near the border to
Northern Karanas. Was messing around with 2 other fellows looking for
grizzlies back when I was 10th lvl. We stopped in the inn to resupply when a
lioness strolls through the wall in the corner and starts to maul me. Then a
lion started mauling another person so we finished off the lioness and
proceeded to kill the lion. Suddenly I saw the text a hill giant hits Kebik
for 90 pts of damage....a hill giant bashes Kebik for 50 pts of
damage...dead. Then this guy starts in on me. hits me twice and I'm still
running, opened the door....he misses me...Take 5 steps and then I see the
LOADING PLEASE WAIT..
>
> Me dead. Alright, I can understand a hill giant ripping off a roof and
beating the crap out of us. That's acceptable...sort of...but the lions
walking through the wall is just wrong. Am I making a point here? No.
Probably not. I guess what I'm trying to say is, yes there's glitches and
bugs. I knew everything would not be totally worked out, because there's
always new things that crop up and they'll eventually be worked out. I'd
still rather play with all the bugs and all, than not play is what it boils
down to.
>
> Oh, while I'm on the subject I'll plug myself.
>
> Anyone interested in joining a guild? If you're on Solusek Ro and are
interested please /tell me or reply to this post via email to me. Don't post
a reply because I'm sure that will piss off a ton of people. We've got
basically 2 rules.
>
> 1. Be helpful to other EQ players (rpging, and evil vs good issues aside I
really can't think of any reason to be a prick to anyone lvls 1-7, we were
all newbies once, and there's more coming. Unless they're complete losers,
ummmm Hamblen a 3rd dwarf comes to mind.)
>
> 2. No whining. This means no bitching and griping about graphic glitches,
unfair monster tactics etc... /petition it, and move on.
>
> That's about it. See ya's !!
>
> Zalbar
> 15th Wizard
> Solusek Ro
>
>
>
>
>

> Message: 24
> Date: Tue, 27 Apr 1999 12:46:45 -0400
> From: "Chris Trubiani" <u1607755@...>
> Subject: Re: BUG/FEEDBACK
>
> Just to inform everyone. This behavior where monsters can attack through
solid object is not a glitch. It is a choice they have made, the code to
turn clipping on for monsters is there. It would be very easy for them to
make it so that monsters cannot attack through things, but they have chosen
to allow this. I personally can't think of any reasons why they would allow
this to happen, but I'm sure they have their reasons.
>
> Tandayen, Dark Elf Wizard
>
>
